name: Work.com
overview:
Work.com, is a social performance management platform. It is marketed as a solution for sales performance management (SPM), customer service, and marketing, and as a service that can be employed by human resources departments for broad use across an organization.

Work.com was acquired originally by Salesforce.com as Rypple in 2011. Rypple was founded by Daniel Debow and David Stein in 2008. It was re-branded as Work.com on September 2012.

The Work.com service facilitates collaboration and shared contribution to individual, team, and organizational goals, and facilitates the exchange of feedback anonymously and publicly between peers and managers. Data gathered in everyday use is collected and made available to create performance summaries and facilitate measurement of individual and organizational performance.

Work.com has partnered with Amazon.com to create a system for administering tangible rewards in the form of Amazon.com Gift Cards.

In 2012, Salesforce announced plans to integrate Work.com with Salesforce.com’s sales, service, and marketing products.
